text: Deep clear dark Amber under a foamy big light tan head. Smoky aroma thats also sweet and fruity with subtle cherry and currant and caramalty booze. Big bold flavor thats smokey with tones of sausage and whatnot but also semi fruity and semisweet with Barleywine esque tones of fruit, berries, definite booze and caramalt. Interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Always complex beers. Aromas and flavors of strong malt with some smoke and caramel. Slight hops presence. Well balanced. Nice deep color and medium weight. Would like to see how it ages.
Shared 12 oz. bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and smoke. Taste is roasted malt, smoke, chocolate notes, and perhaps a hint of dark fruit. Not bad.

Aroma: smoky and slightly fruity; Appearance: very dark amber with thin, offwhite head that lingers; Taste: follows nose with unpleasant malty finish; Overall: not my favorite style; would not buy again.

12 oz bottle shared with drsordr. Pours a clear, deep copper brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have smoked malts, caramel, meaty, woody, some peat, chocolate, dark fruit, raisins, interesting beer.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pour dark cola brown with thin ecru head. Nose raisin, light peat and smoke, hint of anise. Taste sweeter malt up front, raisin and plum, then smoked peat, light peppery spice. Fairly complex flavor progression.
Bottle. Pours quite hazy chestnut, medium beige head, good lacing. Aroma is smoky, oak, grass, caramel. Flavor is light plus sweet, light smoke, light plus bitterness. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle in trade from blutt59, thanks again!
Pours a slightly hazy deep brown color with a small off white head that slowly recedes. Rich caramel and toffee with hints of smoke and licorice. The flavor is more of the smoke than the caramel with a bit of dark fruitiness in there as well. Initially I thought the smoke was a bit to pronounced, but it kind of grew on me. Pretty nice sipper.

Beer description starts off with " complex" that about sums it up. Aroma has smoky, peat malts with some medicinal qualities, as it warms a touch of fruitiness and chocolate comes in. The body looks like flat cola, some yeast floaters, the head is thin and clinging to the side of the glass. The flavor is all over the place smoky, peaty, fruity, caramel, booze. Overall an interesting beer for sure.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a decent beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and fruit. Taste is malt, caramel, dark fruit, and some smoke. Pretty good.

Black, opaque, with minimal tan head. 
Chocolate, vanilla, wood, and molasses aromas. 
Medium sweetness with light bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and average carbonation. 
Coffee, chocolate flavors. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Mahogany color with tan foam. Meaty, peat smoke, toffee, dark raison aromas. Rich, smooth mouthfeel. Nice toffee, toasty, dark fruit, dark raison, light smoke flavors---tasty.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: 22 oz. bottle served in shaker- poured a somewhat transparent when held to a light source dark brown with light maroon tinting in it. One finger tan head formed but absolutely refused to lace upon the vessel. Aroma of light smoke, caramel, black tea, and wet paperboard. Hits the mouth with a medium body, malt tastes like it was heavily toasted with some liquid smoke added to it, middle holds up well, finish is slightly sweet with a cloying kind of sensation with a leather overtone. Another brewery payment for them, another sucker tick for me.

Mahogany in color, flimsy, unstable beige head. Fresh malt aroma, some cardboard, sweet tea, tobacco. Excellent on the tongue, crisp yet mellow, breathy on the finish....boozy but not 10% boozy. Sweet wood, caramel, mint.
Enjoyed at BTBF 2016. Clear brown color. Tan head. Smoky aroma, caramel malts. Sweet , smokey flavor. Good.
(Bottle) Pours a clear amber body with a medium beige head. Aroma of smoke, grain, caramel, and toffee. Flavor of grain, leather, caramel, and ash/smoke.

Saint Arnold Divine Reserve 16 has a thinnish, cream-colored head, a dark, orange-brown appearance, and sheet lacing left behind on the glass. The aroma is of rich, malt, brown bread, brown bread crust, and even brown bread dough. There is an acidic plum note, as well. Taste is of peat smoke, but not to the rauchbier level, with nougat, brown bread crust, plum skin, acidity, caramel, toffee, and relatively low hop bitterness, although it is detected. Mouthfeel is high-medium/low-heavy and slick, and Saint Arnold Divine Reserve 16 finishes on the dry side. RJT
22 oz bottle. Deep brown with a decent beige head. Aroma is of smoked ham, roasted malt, light pine, bacon, and light ash. Taste is of smoke, molasses, burnt toast, smoked pork loin, caramel.
Bottle. The look is dark, brown in color with red tinges, tan colored head. The smell is smoke, malt, heavy, sweet, and good. The taste is malty, rich, smoke, ash, leather, sweet, dried dark fruit.

Bomber. Pours dark brown with a light tan head. Nose has a faint smoke aroma and a slight yeasty roast smell. Taste is the same with a slight caramel sweetness. Just a faint smoke flavor-which is good because Im not a big rauchbier fan. Nice carbonation and a silky smoothness. Nice drinker.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Smokey dark fruit. Pours a dark root beer color with a thin off white head that leaves a film on the glass. The smoke is there but not overpowering. Still more than I like. Other than that its sweet and smooth with some dark fruit flavors. Just a hint of hops edge on the finish. If it wasnt for the smoke it would be a decent beer.

Unique smoky and salty aroma. Smells like barbecue brisket. Interesting light brown color with a light tan head of foam. Tastes salty with light smoke, roasted malt and a slightly hoppy yet oddly refreshing aftertaste. This one is hard to define. I wouldn't seek this one out again but I am glad I tried it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
An Adambier! Awesome. Golden-brown. Flat. Smoky. Toffee. Big smoky toffee business, hit of bitterness. Really very good adambier.

Deep dark brown pour with a dense beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma is smoke, toffee, and a hint of dark fruit. Smoke is there in the taste but is subtle and fades as it warms. Caramel becomes more prominent and there is some earthiness. Medium body. Nice beer.

Bottle thanks to Jacob. Pours a very dark brown with medium bege head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong smoke, burnt toast, caramel. Medium mouth, toasted malt, dark fruit, nice lingering smoke, very nice.
Dark brown with a thin, light beige head. Sweet, dark fruit aroma. Smoky malt flavor, a hint of booziness. Nice one.

Deep, chestnut brown, with a little white head. Aroma is sweet, but very muted, as in theres not enough of it. Taste is smoky and alcoholic, with a caramel-sweet, but sharp finishing edge. $2.79/12oz Rating #2000 from a plastic hotel cup in Dallas
Deep caramel color with thin head. Tastes like a smoked chocolate beer with a thicker Carmel fijish.
Warming without being boozy. Wonderful hop / malt balance and impressive complexity. Smoke is really just a tease. Another fine DR.

Pours very dark with slight reddish hue and thin tan head. Not much on the nose. Taste is mostly roasted malt with some dark fruit and just a hint of smoke. For reference, much less smoke than JW12. Finish, however, is slightly smoky. Alcohol is well hidden and beer is very well integrated and smooth. A delightful pour!
Dark pour with a creme, off white head. Smoke arouma. Very flavorful!..

Nose is really inviting with malt, caramel, and almost lager-y yeast. On the palette, its reminiscent of a barleywine yet theres bitter chocolate and subtle smoke. Solid offering on a rather unavailable style.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 Second rate 3/12/17 (its been in the closet for a year): 9 5 8 4 16 : 4.2

First rate 2/29/16: 8 4 8 4 16 : 4.0 - Very dark, kind of a semi-opaque cola brown. The pale chocolate milk colored head never quite goes away. Aroma of cocoa, ash, caramel and wood. Taste is rich, moderately sweet, a little bitter and smokey with just a hint of alcohol; well balanced yet big. Medium bodied, semi-syrupy, light to average bubbles. Pretty solid stuff.

Always enjoyed the DR series, well, one blip (15) and one turned (7) but still a great series .. . deep brown fro .. head is mild, some spotting, light headring .. the heat warms the throat quite a bit . has a great dose of smoke- caramel, dutch hash ash, hot wood, and brandy infused cocaine .. . really fantastic stuff, ill enjoy drinking this in my yacht, which is what i call my car bed.
